message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the problem of learning similarity functions in computer vision, which is a core topic in the field of computer vision (cs.CV). The paper proposes a new method for generating visual similarity explanations, which involves gradient-based attention and is based on a principled learning mechanism. This method is applicable to various similarity model types, including Siamese, triplet, and quadruplet models, which are all commonly used in computer vision research. The paper also demonstrates the generality of the proposed framework by applying it to a variety of tasks, including image retrieval, person re-identification, and low-shot semantic segmentation, which are all sub-fields of computer vision. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, and cs.MM, in descending order of likelihood.
